response_parsed.title: Deep Dive: NIS Standard Library Module in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer provides an in-depth look at the Network Information Service (NIS) standard library module introduced in Python 3.12, discussing its purpose, usage, and key features.

key_points.description: Network Information Service (NIS) is a Sun Microsystems-developed implementation of the Yellow Pages protocol for distributed data management. It allows for the sharing of system configuration information across a network.
Python 3.12 introduces native support for NIS, providing an efficient and standardized way to access NIS maps within Python applications.

The main components of the NIS module include `getpwnam()`, `getpwuid()`, `getnetbyname()`, `getnetbyaddr()`, and others. These functions allow for querying NIS maps related to users, groups, hosts, services, etc.

Here's a simple example of using the NIS module to retrieve user information: 
```python
import getpass
from pwd import getpwnam
print(getpwnam(getpass.getuser())['pw_gecos'])
```
The NIS module is exclusive to Python 3.12 and later versions.
Ensure your system has the necessary NIS configuration and client software installed for proper functioning of the NIS module in Python.
